description: sign in does nothing.
A few menu glitches here and there but works great.

Reviews for this flatpak are heavily varied because it works for some people, but doesn't work at all for others.

Plex doesn't offer non-sandboxed versions of the desktop app on Linux due to "licensing", but the sandboxed apps aren't well-optimized, and are either missing dependencies, make assumptions about the environment, have incorrect flatpak permissions, or haven't been tested under wayland.

I've seen reports from users that this flatpak wouldn't work until they enabled wayland permissions for it which should have been enabled by default, that users had to install missing packages to get it to work, or that VAAPI hardware acceleration for video playback doesn't work when it works for other apps.

Since this app allows you to play some codecs which Plex explicitly won't allow in a browser, this app is actually the only way to get full compatibility on a Linux system.

In my case, I have to set the environment variable QT_STYLE_OVERRIDE to no value by running it as: 

QT_STYLE_OVERRIDE= tv.plex.PlexDesktop

...just to get the app to launch, and after it does launch, VAAPI acceleration isn't functional on a system where it works just fine in desktop apps and even other flatpaks. There are plenty reports on the Plex forums of this, and very little engagement from Plex to fix the issue. It's unfortunate.
Works great for me no issues so far! ?Been waiting a while for this.

for some reason it works better than the snap store version for 1080p. but 4k videos just don't play. otherwise everything else works fantastic! i'm using debian 11 sid, and nvidia 3090rtx, latest drivers etc. once 4k gets going in an upgrade, it's a 5 star for sure. thanks for making this!

Login was broken before but I can now sign in from desktop mode with plex.

In this version and older the flatpak does not clean up after itself if not shutdown correctly. Once shutdown unclean the servers pid file is not cleaned up preventing Plex from starting up again unless removed manually. When it works it works well.

Run this command in desktop mode: systemctl --user restart xdg-desktop-portal.service

This allows the plex app to open a browser tab.

description:
As of today (14Aug2022) the app works great. Download and sign in while in Desktop mode (I signed in with Chrome first so it would autoload my login credentials) then after using your pin and logging into a Plex user, go to the config and enable "Automatically sign in" then you can close the plex app. Go to Steam and "Add non-steam game" then add Plex and itll work in Game Mode.

To exit plex in game mode, use the "Steam" button to exit the application.
On SteamDeck - Open Chrome in the background, click Login and wait a second for the website to open up and then sign in.
install chrome first. then works like a charm

Alright, so I tried installing this on my first Steam Deck, and everything worked just fine, I clicked the Log In button, it opened the log in page in my browser, and all was well. Then I went to install this on my second Steam Deck, and I COULD NOT get it to log in no matter what I tried... but I found a fix.

Many times the Steam Deck will have issues with flatpaks that all come down to the xdg desktop portal. You can restart it by going into Konsole and running the following:

systemctl restart --user xdg-desktop-portal

I found this information on the SGDBoop page (steamgriddb.com/boop), as I was also having issues getting that to work as well, but that fix works for Plex as well, as it will probably also work for other flatpaks that are experiencing issues.

I dunno about all the one star reviews from SteamDeck users. I mean we have the same hardware, yet: 
Some mentions it does not even starts anymore. For me it's perfectly fine.
Some says it opens Chrome even when Firefox is installed. Well, i have Firefox set as default browser, and it opens that, when it comes to log in.
Also some says login does not work. It does. It is true, that after that Plex thinks for a while, but i guess it's just fetches data.
Countless times i saw, that in this "app store" a lot of people rate down apps mentioning similar problems, making them 2 or 3 stars, which makes people (or at least me) think twice, before trying them. But in this place i guess as long as you know the app is legit, you can give it a try. 
(Obviously there is always the possibility, that by the time i came arround, it got fixed from all the problems, so as of 2023.09.18, Plex works great)

Brand new Fedora 39 install. Only works on Wayland. If I try to open on X11 plex-bin immeadiately crashes. When it does open, the playback is laggy and stuttering regardless of video codec or container. H265 10-bit mkv and medium quality 1080p h264 8-bit mp4 both are somehow even worse than the web ui. NVIDIA shield playback is fine, the network speed and transcoding ability of the server are perfect, it is simply a poorly made flatpak and I can't get any support for it.

Installed it on Ubuntu 22.04 (running on an older HP Chromebook X360, Google Nami with coreboot) and it works perfect. Tried different codecs and qualities. Same experience as on my NVidia shield. No clue why it got so negative reviews here.
Installed it on my Steam Deck works without any issues
Works just fine, Idk whats up with low star reviews
